qas.question: Which philosopher of the Muslim world is considered an important author of work on evolution?
Ibn al-Haytham can be known by another name, what is it?
What type of work is Ibn al-Haytham known to have pioneered?

answers.text: phenomenology and the philosophy of science

qas.question: Who is considered to have been the one that founded Illuminationist philosophy?
Which philosopher in the Muslim world championed inductive logic in their works?
Who is credited with further developing Illuinationist philosophy?
What natural philosophy did Tufail ctiticize?

context: Other influential Muslim philosophers include <a0_0>al-Jahiz<a0_0/>, a pioneer in evolutionary thought; Ibn al-Haytham (<a1_0>Alhazen<a1_0/>), a pioneer of <a2_0>phenomenology and the philosophy of science<a2_0/> and a critic of Aristotelian natural philosophy and Aristotle's concept of place (topos); Al-Biruni, a critic of <b6_0>Aristotelian natural philosophy<b6_0/>; Ibn Tufail and Ibn al-Nafis, pioneers of the philosophical novel; <a3_0><b5_0>Shahab al-Din Suhrawardi<a3_0/>,<b5_0/> founder of Illuminationist philosophy; <a4_0>Fakhr al-Din al-Razi<a4_0/>, a critic of <b7_0>Aristotelian logic<b7_0/> and a pioneer of inductive logic; and Ibn Khaldun, a pioneer in the philosophy of history.
